content.value: The Linux help system provides built-in tools that help users understand commands, options, and usage without needing the internet.
content.example: Example: Using the man command to learn how ls works.

content.value: Linux has thousands of commands and options. It is impossible to memorize everything. The Linux help system allows users to quickly find information about commands directly from the terminal.
man (manual) is a command that displays detailed documentation for Linux commands.
content.example: Example: Reading the manual page for the ls command.
